alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 3:02AM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph over exposed ridges. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will fall at elevations above 4000 feet Monday. However, snow levels will fall to the valley floors by early Tuesday morning. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hours Monday night and Tuesday with create hazardous conditions. Interstate 90 east of Snoqualmie Summit is forecast to receive 10 to 15 inches of new snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
